description:
The greenest bluegrass in town

Kentucky's Best is a masterful blend of Kentucky bluegrass and perennial ryegrass, designed for those seeking a lawn that excels in aesthetics and functionality. This premium mix establishes a thick, emerald grass prized for its deep green color, soft texture, and cold resilience. Ideal for creating a lush, inviting outdoor space, Kentucky’s Best ensures a durable lawn that stands up to changing conditions while maintaining its luxurious appeal.

sections.why_kentucky_s_best_is_our_pick_for_cool:
Deep emerald green color
Excellent wear tolerance
Early spring green up—and winter color retention
High heat, drought, and disease resistance
A-LIST-approved for quality, sustainability, and reduced maintenance
Grows well in full shade to partial sun and in a wide range of soils
Suitable for any cool-season lawn and grass type
High 85% germination rate
sections.whats_included:
2 types of premium Kentucky Bluegrass and 2 types of premium perennial ryegrass varieties
One bag covers up to 2,500 sq. ft. of lawn
Sunday seeding rate
For maintenance seeding or overseeding: 2 lbs./1000 sq. ft.
For heavy repair, weedy lawns, and new lawns: 2 lbs./1000 sq. ft.
sections.faq:
Helpful Tips from Lawn Advisors:
What is Kentucky bluegrass?
It’s a premium cool-season grass offering quick green up and disease resilience. It thrives in full sun to light shade and grows a dense, soft, emerald turf that's cold-tolerant yet demands careful water management in drought.
When to plant Kentucky Bluegrass seed?
The optimal time to seed this mix is during spring and fall when temperatures consistently range between 55 and 75 degrees Fahrenheit. You can also seed this mix in winter months when temperatures consistently fall below 40 degrees F.
How long does fescue grass seed take to grow?
Expect germination between 6-21 days.
How to plant Kentucky bluegrass seed
Apply at the correct rate.
For overseeding, use 2 lbs. per 1,000 sq. ft.; for starting a new lawn from scratch, use 2 lbs. per 1,000 sq. ft. For patching, cover the area lightly with seed and topdress with compost or a light layer of soil if desired.
Start at the lowest setting and apply uniformly.
For hand or drop spreader applications, no matter the spreader type, always begin at the lowest setting. Increase the spreader setting if the seed is getting stuck or not easily distributed. Walk at a consistent pace across the lawn to distribute seed uniformly. Check after application for uniformity and reapply in areas where coverage is light.
Water the seed to germination.
Keep the seed moist, not oversaturated, until the grass seed germinates—depending on the grass type, this can be 1-3 weeks. Avoid letting new or germinating seeds dry out to ensure successful seeding.
Sunday Grass Seed Instructions
Step-by-step instructions on how to seed Sunday's premium cool-season grass seed for a thicker, climate-resilient, and weed-free lawn.
